job_title: Agency RN, Perdiem in Danbury, CT
pros: Organized, patient centered, excellent salary, great nurse managers, flexible
cons: Charting has to be 100% perfect and does everything to the T. Performance improvement team can be really intense.

pros: I have good director however, like any job, that varies.
cons: Top heavy and like hiring from outside for supervisors and managers who don’t know basics about Nuvance network. Good people maybe but that makes it hard when you have to explain to a manager things they should know. And they would know if promoted from within. Do not show employee appreciation. Raises are awful and goal system is so cumbersome. Good idea, however execution is time-waster and painful process for employees and supervisors. If admin wants to show they care (even if pretend), show up on worker-bee level once in a while.

review_title: It was all good then awful
job_title: Health Information Specialist in Poughkeepsie, NY
pros: Good hours, nice training program
cons: Favoritism, horrible communication with management, high school bullying tactics that forced me to immediately resign.

review_title: Not how I imagined it would be
pros: Mostly very nice colleagues and associates, flexible hours, clinical management was not toxic, well-paced, caring, pleasant environment, immediate environment was very supportive
cons: HR and senior management seen to have an odd idea about how management should manage and what makes an employee a good employee. My immediate manager was absent to a fault; my guess is that this person was being slammed with work. There was a very strong party line propagated by senior management meant to motivate and guide employee behavior. I found it ineffective, condescending and disingenuous. I did my best to ignore this unfortunate aspect of the job.

review_title: High turnover of staff and pay is not competitive
pros: Most coworkers are positive and helpful. Health benefits like all other hospitals Bravo is a benefit if you want to be placed into a different tax bracket and you pay taxes on any amount.
cons: Too much management that do nothing and no working staff Profit before patient attitude. Will freeze salaries and didn’t receive bonuses like promised and bonuses kept secret so you won’t receive them. Favoritism and backstabbing situations by managers and supervisors No chance for advancement or education On call pay was incorrectly paid They do not care about your home/work balance due to staffing issues. Are eliminating positions and not hiring. NY vs CT side effects the network. Norwalk is a second thought to all others. Due to short staffing they put you in a position that compromises safety

review_title: No real diversity, especially at the top (take a look around)
pros: 403b has a better than average match at 6%.
cons: Terrible executive team. Extremely "homogenous" if you get my drift. Some have since retired as it was way past their time to leave, including the crusty president of the hospital who needed to retire yesterday and is finally retiring. Anyone who is interested in the quality leadership roles at Vassar Brothers in Poughkeepsie, BE CAREFUL! It is a revolving door and almost all prior quality directors have been FIRED. The CQO is a snob, vindictive, merciless, and is full of w- privilege. You've been warned.

review_title: Unprofessional, Political and Belligerent work environment
pros: Local Community Hospitals. Good place for starting out or just for a "job".
cons: Extremely political. Terrible management. Hated the working environment. Lots of infighting and unhappy employees. Does not pay well. Favoritism rules - it's all about who you know, not what you know.

cons: Entitled co workers, negligent management

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Danbury, CT

cons: My office had no windows My supervisor was burnt out Culture in the CCBH program was unprofessional.

pros: very decent pay and benefits
cons:
they will overwork you as they are short staffed all the time, patient census is crazy 20-25 pts a day but when they are recruiting you will tell you the census is about 15 patients/day, they decide to change things and not inform you,
chief hospitalist is not understanding if there are personal issues and she can be outright nasty at times, they don't care if you are dying you are required to work your shift, nurses constantly calling you for minor things, trying to get them to pay you for CME and benefits is awful as they will fight you tooth and nail before they pay you the money

pros: Enjoy working with my co-workers
cons: Not as competitive as other hospitals in the area

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Poughkeepsie, NY

cons: Not paid enough for the size of hospital and amount of work technicians do

pros: Gives a lot of experience depending on department
cons: Management usually doesn't care, they want good numbers

pros: Salary is ok not the best -that’s all I can honestly think of. (When we get reviews we are told we are lucky we still have a job and no raises this year - for clinical staff)
cons:
Denied lunch breaks, Management not present or supportive. toxic work culture with bullies and favorites. high turnover. poor health insurance. 
HR dept telling new staff “you are not the only one being hired so stop harassing me with phone calls” Took full two months to start. Don’t expect them to return calls once they hire you - ghosted for a month then HR started process after yelling at me. 
Too many administrators pushing papers and too little hands on staffing and support. 
Only concerned about money not patients or outcome. All business nothing personal. Admin doesn’t even know anything about staff or what they do. They are not clinical at all. Company has been taken over by Connecticut Admin.

pros: Good pay, great benefits, 1199 union
cons: Management penalizes you for every little thing.

job_title: Radiation Therapy Technologist (Rtt) in Norwalk, CT
pros:
Match the 401 with a good percentage. 
Healthcare benefits incentives to earn credits towards premiums 
There were lots of positive pros but the CEO has taken them away
cons:
Health insurance limited
Turnover high
No bonuses for working through pandemic 
Raises are low and market surveys not done on a regular bases
Years of experience doesn’t matter and new employees will come in right under senior salary 
Favoritism is an issue and all employees not treated equal
Management not responsive especially to those who go above and beyond. 
No room for growth. Training and meetings given to favorites instead of being rotated 
Capped PTO and rollover should be increased 
Lack of communication on all levels 
Insurance benefits force you back into a very limited physician network
NY times article from October is a good read

review_title: You can afford to live here if you work here!

pros: Benefits, Mon-Friday work schedule with flexibly
cons: This place loves to merge without fixing or addresses my previous issues or problems. After they merge new problems arise and they start working on the new problems. New problems can’t be fixed unless you address the older ones first. Management can’t recognize a knowledgeable valuable employee unless suggested as a favorite from other management. Management would rather cut their nose off to spite their face instead of promoting someone who deserves it vs someone that they ‘like’. Employees are not appreciated. New management is 100% absent.

review_title: Terrible Company and Desperate for Another Health System to Buy Them Out!
pros: Co-workers commiserate on how miserable it is. The other pro is I no longer work there.
cons:
Nauseatingly talk about patient safety but furthest from it. So understaffed . 
 What were they thinking pouring hundreds of millions into a new building they can't even staff? 

Patients are lost in the shuffle in the massive, isolated rooms that were never intended to be so understaffed at every possible level: from nursing to PCTs, to housekeeping and supply staff. 

Administrative team at VBMC is a joke. Utterly clueless. 

Always a new wave of layoffs that began more than a year ago. Seems to happen every few months. 

They have been looking for a suitor to acquire Nuvance Health and acquire the massive debt they got into from a comedy of STUPENDOUS errors.

pros: Pays well. Clean environment. Single bed rooms on inpatient floors
cons: Corporate take over of small community hospitals are never a good thing.

pros: Decent pay for the area

pros: I no longer work there
cons:
*Totally understaffed and overworked
*Upper management were horrible, no confidentiality, favorites, didn't know anything about how the practice worked. Upper Management Were not team players, wouldn't help in office although we were totally understaffed. Will throw the staff "under the bus" to save their behinds when they screw up. 
* Constantly threaten your job, micromanage you to death. 
* Make you work at another office(to help their understaffing issue) more than an hour away and give you no notice either although your office was totally understaffed.
* Do not distribute workload evenly. VERY UNFAIR. 
* Administrative division treated BETTER than the Clinical Divisions.
* Pay is NOT competitive at all. (Hence the understaffing issues).
*Can never use PTO. (Understaffing Excuses) 6 weeks notice needed to be given to get a day off, even in a medical/dental emergency or else given warnings /write ups.
*Retail Hours - never know what hours you are going to work until the week before and every day is different.
